questions.question: What are the three Zn-BTC MOFs synthesized via a structure-directing approach?
Which Zn-BTC MOFs showed extraordinary catalytic performance in the cycloaddition of CO2 under solvent- and halogen-free conditions?
What was the yield of propylene carbonate using BIT-103 as a catalyst?
How does the pore size and accessibility of BIT-101 compare to BIT-102 and BIT-103?
questions.answer: The pore size and accessibility of BIT-101 are smaller, limiting its activity compared to BIT-102 and BIT-103.

questions.question: What is the significance of using A-BDC and N-BDC in the synthesis of Zn-BTC MOFs?
questions.answer: A-BDC and N-BDC were used as structure-directing agents to influence the architectures and underlying topologies of the Zn-BTC MOFs.

questions.question: True or False: BIT-103 requires additional co-catalysts for the cycloaddition of CO2 to cyclic carbonates.
True or False: BIT-101, BIT-102, and BIT-103 have the same underlying topologies.
What was the method used for the synthesis of BIT-101, BIT-102, and BIT-103?
questions.answer: A structure-directing approach was used for the synthesis.

questions.question: What is the role of active metal sites in Zn-BTC MOFs for catalysis?
questions.answer: Active metal sites in Zn-BTC MOFs provide numerous potential catalytic centers, facilitating the cycloaddition of CO2 to cyclic carbonates.

questions.question: True or False: The yield and TON of BIT-103 outperform many effective homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysts reported to date.
What was the conversion rate of propylene epoxide using BIT-103?
How does the reuse capability of BIT-103 affect its catalytic properties?
questions.answer: BIT-103 can be fully recovered and reused without losing its catalytic activity, making it suitable for industrial applications.

questions.question: True or False: BIT-102 and BIT-103 have different coordination environments of zinc atoms.
What was the selectivity to cyclic carbonate when using BIT-103 as a catalyst?
True or False: The catalytic performance of BIT-103 in the cycloaddition of CO2 and propylene epoxide is unaffected by the number of reuse cycles.
What is the impact of pore size on the catalytic activity of Zn-BTC MOFs?
questions.answer: Larger pore sizes in BIT-102 and BIT-103 allow for higher catalytic activity compared to BIT-101, which has smaller pores.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of BIT-101, BIT-102, and BIT-103 did not require any additives.
What factors contribute to the high catalytic performance of BIT-102 and BIT-103?
questions.answer: The high catalytic performance is attributed to their larger pore sizes, active metal sites, and the absence of a need for additional co-catalysts.

questions.question: True or False: BIT-101 has the same catalytic performance as BIT-102 and BIT-103 in the cycloaddition of CO2.
What are the advantages of using BIT-103 for the cycloaddition of CO2 to cyclic carbonates?
questions.answer: BIT-103 offers satisfactory yields, high selectivity, an environmentally friendly process without the need for solvents or additives, and reusability.
